p: For an overview of the Sideritis species in the Balkan area, mountain tea was analyzed by mass spectrometry coupled to high-performance liquid chromatography with diode-array detection. The analysis found that it contains 90% phenylethanoid glycosides and flavonoid acetylglycosides [ 82]. Turkish S. scardica oil has β-pinene in abundance as compared to the Greek version which contains α-pinene primarily. Both these varieties are mainly rich in monoterpene hydrocarbons unlike the ones from Macedonia and Bulgaria, which are poor in these compounds [ 83]. Significant differences in components have also been proven between the fresh and dried versions of the plant material [ 84].
